title: Zekko
content:
Zekko is a gear brand in the Splatoon series. Zekko clothing has a 5× chance to roll Special Saver and a 0.5× chance to get Special Charge Up as a secondary ability.

Zekko's clothing theme appears to be a mixture of streetwear and formal clothes, but mainly clothing that relates to skate-punk fans, such as a cap worn the opposite way, a hoodie and lo-top shoes. They also produce checkered shirts, letterman jackets and hawaiian shirts adorned with logos of the brand.

According to @SplatoonJP, Zekko produces street-style fashion for young Inklings.[1]

In Splatoon 3, Zekko merged with Firefin to form Z+F.[2][3]

- Alongside clothing, Zekko seemingly sells bikes too, as bikes with Zekko's logo are displayed in Splatoon 2's Arowana Mall and parked in Inkopolis Square.
This could also be the reason Zekko produces and sells bike helmets.

- Zekko may also sell cars, as cars with the Zekko logo often drive by on stages such as Starfish Mainstage.

- In Splatoon, there is no Zekko gear with Bomb Sniffer, Haunt, Ink Resistance Up, Opening Gambit, Run Speed Up, Special Saver or Stealth Jump as a primary ability.

- In Splatoon 2, there is no Zekko gear with Drop Roller, Special Saver or Stealth Jump as a primary ability.

- In Splatoon 3, due to them merging into Z+F, Firefin and Zekko are the only brands to not receive any new gear.
